page.title: 04RICKFORD POND
page.content: { RICKFORD POND}IS A VERY DEEP ONE.IT IS ABOUT 80 METRES BY 37 METRES AND ABOUT 4 METRES DEEP.THE WATER WHICH FILLS UP THE POND COMES OUT OF THE MENDIP HILLS.IN 1968 THERE WAS SO MUCH WATER THAT IT OVERFLOWED EVEN WITH THE FLOOD BARRIERS OPEN. THE POND HOLDS OVER 200,000 GALLONS AND IT WAS BUILT BEFORE THE REIGN OF JAMES THE FIRST.A MILL WAS BUILT AT THE SAME TIME AS THE POND.FIRST IT WAS A FLOUR MILL THEN A PAPER MILL.THEY WERE BOTH POWERED BY THE WATER FROM THE POND.THE MILL IS NOW IN RUINS BUT THE MILL HOUSE IS STILL THERE. THERE IS A{SMALL ISLAND}IN THE MIDDLE OF THE POND. THERE ARE BIRDS SUCH AS HERONS,DUCKS AND SWANS THAT LIVE ON THE ISLAND. RICKFORD POND AND THE MILL HOUSE ARE OFTEN USED AS SUBJECTS FOR PAINTINGS AND PHOTOGRAPHS.
